content: Legislation to rewrite and reauthorize the Export Administration Act of 1979 (EAA) may be considered in the 111th Congress. Several pieces of legislation in the 110th Congress addressed penalties, enforcement, diversion of goods, and integration of export control data. The EAA controls sensitive dual-use goods and technologies with civilian and military applications, including those that can contribute to the proliferation of weapons. The EAA has been periodically reauthorized since its expiration in 1989, with the last extension expiring in August 2001. The export licensing system under the EAA is currently continued through the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA).
